question: One of the consequences of improved medical care is that people are living longer and life expectancy is increasing.Do you think the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
text: It is true that a lot of constructions, such as buildings and offices are now built
with an open-space design. While it can be argued that having constructions built
with an open-space design is beneficial, I still believe that the disadvantages
outweigh the advantages, and this is a negative development.
There are two main reasons why people might believe that this is a positive
development. Firstly, the relationships between employees might be better. This
is because working in an open-space area brings employees closer together
physically, breaking down the invisible wall between people. As a result,
employees can interact with their colleagues more easily, making it more
approachable. Lastly, it might have positive effects on the collaboration between
colleagues. As employees are bring closer together, they have better
communication and interaction with each other. This benefits employees with a
better flow of information, resulting in better management for managers.
Despite the above arguments, I still believe that the disadvantages outweigh the
advantages. Firstly, working together in an open-space area might lead to the
lack of privacy. Since workers sit closely to each other, every of their actions
might be observed by their colleagues. Sometimes, work is sensitive, and being
able to see everyone’s screen might be disruptive. Secondly, working in an open-
plan area might lead to greater distractions. Working close to each other without
walls to separate people can be noisy and chaotic, especially in call centers. This
results in the fact that employees can’t focus on their work, decreasing their
efficiency. Lastly, it might end up in a higher risk of diseases spreading. This is
because employees work fairly close to each other, so the chance of an infectious
disease spreading might be very high.
In conclusion, while there are benefits of open-plan design, I still believe that this
is a negative development, and the disadvantages outweigh the advantages.

error_list.error_des: It appears that your sentence or clause uses an incorrect form of the verb bring. Consider changing it.
It appears that the singular demonstrative This is modifying the plural noun employees. Consider using a plural demonstrative or a singular noun instead.
The word closely doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The determiner every may be incorrect in this context. Consider replacing it with a different determiner.
The spelling of centers is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
